questions.text: I am comfortable living in a joint family setup.
I would like my parents to live with us in the future.
I am okay with my partner’s family staying with us after marriage.
I enjoy frequent visits from extended family.
I value family approval in major life decisions.
I am comfortable sharing financial responsibilities equally.
I prefer maintaining separate finances after marriage.
I actively plan and manage my savings and investments.
I’m okay if my partner earns significantly more or less than me.
I believe financial support for parents is a shared responsibility.
I follow religious customs and rituals regularly.
I enjoy participating in traditional festivals and family functions.
I am open to marrying someone from a different religion or caste.
I would prefer my partner to follow the same religious practices.
I strongly value traditional values and customs in daily life.
I handle conflicts and disagreements in a calm and rational manner.
I believe both partners should have equal say in family decisions.
Personal space is very important to me in a relationship.
I would always discuss major decisions with my partner before acting.
I believe compromise is essential in a healthy marriage.
I will fully support my partner’s career ambitions.
I am open to relocating for either mine or my partner’s job.
Career growth is a top priority for me.
I am okay with my partner having a demanding job with late hours.
I am willing to take a break from work for family if needed.
I want to have children in the future.
I would like to have children within the first 2-3 years of marriage.
I am open to the idea of adoption.
I believe parenting responsibilities should be equally divided.
I would like to have pets and share responsibilities with my partner.
I value complete honesty and transparency in a relationship.
I consider infidelity a complete dealbreaker.
I prefer knowing about my partner’s past relationships.
I believe jealousy and possessiveness are unhealthy in love.
I can forgive and move on from relationship mistakes.
